sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of financial fraud occurring in a company
message_1: What is the probability that a company with 50 employees will experience at least one fraud case involving embezzlement over the course of a year, given that historically 3 out of every 100 companies of this size face such an issue each year?
message_2:
Given that historically 3 out of every 100 companies of this size face such an issue each year, the probability of a company experiencing at least one fraud case involving embezzlement is 3/100 or 0.03.

To find the probability of the opposite event (not experiencing any fraud case), we can subtract the probability of experiencing a fraud case from 1:

1 - 0.03 = 0.97

Now, we can use this probability to calculate the probability of at least one fraud case occurring in a company with 50 employees over the course of a year.

The probability of no fraud cases occurring in a company with 50 employees is (0.97)^50, since each employee has a 0.97 chance of not being involved in a fraud case.
